result.execSummary:
All charges against Jeremiah D Glammeier in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremiah D Glammeier is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah D Glammeier appeared by video in custody from the Eau Claire jail.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared by video for Jeremiah D Glammeier. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF140, 22CF12, 21CF148

State - 21CF148 plea to Ct 1 - 5 years prison. 2 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES. ES conditions: No contact with JSK dob: 2/26/78 or residence. Follow rec of agent. Costs with each conv. Misd $463.00 and Fel $548.00. 61 days jail credit.   Ct 2 dismissed. 
22CF12 plea to Ct 2 - 6 months jail. 2 days jail credit. Cts 1, 3 & 4 dismissed. 
22CF140 - dismissed   

Atty Lundeen - that is the agreement.  DE - understands agreement.
Court - provides plea colloquy
DE - enters No Contest plea to Count 1 of 21CF148. Enters No Contest plea to Count 2 of 22CF12.
Parties stipulate to the facts
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.
State - asks court to accept joint agreement. No restitution requested. Victim rights have been complied with. Asks that this be concurrent to any other sentence serving.
Atty Lundeen - agrees court should accept joint agreement. Asks court to find him eligible for programming while incarcerated.
State - does not object to programming for DE if he is eligible.
DE - makes a statement to the court.

Court orders -
22CF140 - dismissed

22CF12 - (concurrent to any other sentence serving)
Count 2 - 6 months jail. 2 days jail credit. Costs of $463.00 
Counts 1, 3 & 4 - dismissed

21CF148 - (concurrent to any other sentence serving)
Count 1 - 5 years prison. 2 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES. 
61 days jail credit
ES conditions: No contact with J.S.K. dob: 2/26/78 or residence N4682 State Hwy 25, Menomonie, WI. Follow recommendations of agent. 
Costs of $548.00
Eligible for CIP and SAP

Count 2 - dismissed

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah D Glammeier appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Tomtschik - rcvd complaint. waive reading. 
State - asking for $1,000 sign bond. Absolute sobriety.
Atty Tomtschik - no bond obj. waive time limits on prelim hearing.
Court - orders $1,000 sign bond. Absolute sobriety.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
